title: Ken Pillonel adds an Apple Lightning port to an Android phone
content:
Swiss Robotics and data science student Ken Pillonel modded an iPhone X to use a USB Type-C connector last year, replacing the usual Apple Lightning connector found on all modern iPhone models. It was an impressive technical achievement, but now Pillonel is attempting the reverse: adding a Lightning connector to an Android phone. Ken Pillonel

The post Ken Pillonel adds an Apple Lightning port to an Android phone appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Ken Pillonel, the engineer who modded an iPhone X to have a USB Type-C port last year, has now accomplished the opposite modification.
